posts.post_content: This card was an absolute beast at the prerelease, and it was the 2nd most effective card in my deck behind the [sun titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=sun titan). My opponents held back constantly out of pure fear, only to eventually eat a [frost breath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=frost breath) or get tapped down by [gideon's lawkeeper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=gideon's lawkeeper). It's so awesome how all the gideon cards work together. It definitely earned a place in my personal hall of fame.

posts.post_content:
Ajani's Pridemate was better. While this card doesn't require a deck to be built around it nearly as much, the big issue is that, in most cases, it requires your opponent to both be running creatures and tapping those creatures. At least with Pridemate you could force him into being a big beater on the back of your own deck.  
  
Will be a standout in limited though.

posts.post_content:
Awesome creature. Has old white's ability to leave opponents weary to attack, and new white's ever strengthening creature power. A stong and awesome soldier who works wonders with [Gideon's Lawkeeper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gideon's Lawkeeper) and the plainswalker himself... perhaps one of the best in the set- for sure one of the most fun :)
  
   
Also, artwork is awesome. Reminds me of Game of Thrones...

Posted By: itsverystrange (7/23/2011 7:00:06 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I wouldn't say that this grows faster or even as fast as [Ajani's Pridemate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ajani's Pridemate). Ajani's Pridemate can be grown using your own creatures, while Gideon's Avenger can only grow as fast as your opponent lets it. If the opponent has one flyer hitting each turn, this card will take awhile to become powerful. Ajani's Pridemate can grow much much quicker imo, especially with multiple [Soul Warden](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Soul Warden)s or [Soul's Attendant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Soul's Attendant)s out.
posts.html:
I wouldn't say that this grows faster or even as fast as Ajani's Pridemate. Ajani's Pridemate can be grown using your own creatures, while Gideon's Avenger can only grow as fast as your opponent lets it. If the opponent has one flyer hitting each turn, this card will take awhile to become powerful. Ajani's Pridemate can grow much much quicker imo, especially with multiple Soul Wardens or Soul's Attendants out.

Posted By: Adallace (9/11/2011 3:38:30 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Excellent design, your opponents are S.O.L. for not drawing into removal early on. However, much like [Dauntless Escort](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dauntless Escort), which dies horribly and doesn't do anything vs control, this is going to eat the removal spell quickly against a creature deck. It's just counter-intuitive; its ability is so good that it's probably not going to get used. I prefer my bolt-bait to cost 2 mana or less. I'll make an exception for [Mentor of the Meek](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mentor of the Meek) because he's pure card advantage and [Mirran Crusader](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mirran Crusader) because he has pro-black and double strike.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
This card has the guts to stand toe to toe with [Ajani's Pridemate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ajani's Pridemate). For one thing, it is a lot cheaper and quicker to grow, will cause some serious disorder with your opponents deck, assuming that they're not obsessed with vigilance, and comboes with a ridiculous amount of cards, white and blue. So, I definitely think this card is amazing, with the only disadvantage being the cost. Two would have been a more fair, at least to set store by its rival.
  
   
4.5/5

posts.post_content:
I don't like this card at all.  
  
First of all, I believe this card and [Gideon's Lawkeeper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gideon's Lawkeeper) should be both blue and I would rather swap the color with [Wake Thrasher](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wake Thrasher). This creature combos MUCH better with [Sleep](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sleep), [Frost Breath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Frost Breath), [Frost Titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Frost Titan), [Cryptic Command](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cryptic Command), [Narcolepsy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Narcolepsy), [Gigadrowse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gigadrowse), [Deluge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deluge), [Flood](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Flood) or [Siren's Call](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Siren's Call) than with Gideon or Gideon's lawkeeper. And it feels even more strange that the Avenger gets stronger when an opponent taps a [Bird of Paradise](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bird of Paradise) or a [Ghost-Lit Redeemer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ghost-Lit Redeemer).  
  
This brings me to Gideon himself. His "all creatues must attack him" is a failed way to print a [Veteran Bodyguard](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Veteran Bodyguard) as a Planeswalker. FORCING an opponent to attack is strictly contrary to any white flavor concept. Therefore, I woul... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:

First of all, I believe this card and Gideon's Lawkeeper should be both blue and I would rather swap the color with Wake Thrasher. posts.post_content:
I never could figure out what 'Hieromancy' was, mechanically, on Gideon Jura. Was it the first ability or the second? Now I know.   
  
"Hieromancy" is Magic the Gathering's Dungeon Master: *'The Rules say you die now. Play Again?'*  
  
If they have Vigilance, the Lawkeeper'll throw the book at 'em and The Rules Say You Die anyway.   
  
Lulz I don't think I've seen a Planeswalker spike so hard from ignominy to awesomeness. He saw some play, fine, sure...but he didn't feel at all like you could build a theme deck with him. He ALWAYS brought 'Super Friends'. Im thinking this changes that. :P
